title: Abacela 2014 Barrel Select Red (Umpqua Valley)
description: Dry Portuguese red wines are all the rage, and yet virtually unknown (and ungrown) in the U.S. This pure varietal example offers a mix of purple berries, a somewhat chalky mouthfeel, and tannins with the astringency of tea leaves.

title: Alexana 2015 Signature Pinot Noir (Dundee Hills)
description: This barrel selection from the estate's Revana vineyard offers medium concentration and tart fruit flavors of wild berries and Bing cherries. The acids add a note of citrus, but overall this lacks a bit of the oomph expected in a reserve.

title: Alexana 2015 West Blocks Sedimentary Soils Pinot Noir (Dundee Hills)
description: Though at first it feels a bit thin in the mouth, this block selection has pleasant strawberry fruit, with hints of compost in the bouquet and the finish. With ample aeration it expands a bit, then fades gently through a clean finish.

title: Argentiera 2015 Villa Donoratico  (Bolgheri)
description: Aromas of black-skinned berry, tilled soil and cedar lead the way on this Cabernet Sauvignon, Cabernet Franc, Merlot and Petit Verdot blend. The dense palate offers dried black currant, licorice and star anise alongside polished tannins.

title: August Briggs 2014 Petite Sirah (Calistoga)
description: Smoky char and bacon give this wine a lot of personality and depth—big-time flavors that highlight a soft velvety texture of concentration. Brawny and broad, it's a powerhouse of ripeness and richness.

title: Avante 2014  Ribera del Duero
description: Hot, minty aromas of burnt oak, graphite and road tar introduce a fiery palate. Burnt-oak flavors turn resiny and towards mocha and blackberry as the wine breathes. Keeping with a theme set from the start, this is fiery on the finish, with toasty, blackened flavors.

title: Barone Pizzini 2013 Satèn  (Franciacorta)
description: Aromas of bread crust, walnut and citrus carry over to the linear, slightly lean palate along with a saline-like mineral note. It's vibrant and refined, with small, continuous bubbles.

title: Eikendal 2015 Janina Unwooded Chardonnay (Western Cape)
description: This is bright and attractive, with easy-pleasing notes of fresh apple flesh, honeydew, citrus pith and yellow flowers on the nose and mouth. A lightly pithy texture and bright acidity shape the finish, with final notes of tart apple and plum. Drink now.

title: Golan Heights Winery 2014 Yarden Malbec (Galilee)
description: Inky red violet to the eye, this wine offers a bouquet of black cherry and anise. It is smooth on the palate, with flavors of bramble fruit, black plum, fennel bulb and black pepper. The tannins are soft, dropping off before the cherry and anisette finish.

title: Grattamacco 2014  Bolgheri Superiore
description: A blend of Cabernet Sauvignon, Merlot and Sangiovese, this opens with aromas of black-skinned berry, mocha and cedar. The dense palate delivers blackberry jam, licorice and tobacco alongside austere tannins. Enjoy through 2021.

title: Günther Steinmetz 2015 Unfiltered Pinot Noir (Mosel)
description: Pale and slightly bricked in hue, this delicately concentrated Pinot Noir offers a rather ghostly expression of the grape. Its floral perfume suggests dried violets and lavender and its brandied cherry and berry notes are faded and demure. Dusty tannins are soft but pleasantly bitter on the finish. It's showing signs of maturity already so enjoy now through 2021.

title: Joseph Cattin 2016 Pinot Blanc (Alsace)
description: Pure Conference pear notes dominate the nose and palate. This shows some concentration that is balanced by fresh acidity. The finish is dry and fruity.

title: KWV 2015 The Mentors Orchestra Red (Stellenbosch)
description: This blend of Cabernet Franc, Cabernet Sauvignon, Malbec, Merlot and Petit Verdot is dense and heady, with bold scents of black-fruit preserves, blackberry, licorice, mocha and balsamic. The crushed-velvet texture is supported by fine yet gripping tannins, lending ample structure to the dark black plum and cherry fruit flavors. Final notes of tree bark, leather and olive tapenade grace the close. Drink now–2022.

title: Leoness 2014 Cabernet Sauvignon (Temecula Valley)
description: Licorice spice, black cherry cordial, sweet sage and rustic earthy aromas show on the nose of this bottling, which also includes 14% Cabernet Franc, 8% Merlot and 3% Petit Verdot. Blackberry, pepper and dark cocoa are evident on the sip, along with more of that tangy licorice spice and bay leaf flavor.

title: Lo Sparviere 2012 Brut  (Franciacorta)
description: Toasted nut, bread crust and mature yellow stone-fruit aromas lead the nose. The vibrant palate offers creamy yellow apple, tangy lemon zest and almond alongside a lively perlage.

title: Maetierra Dominum 2009 QP Reserva  (Rioja)
description: Earthy berry aromas come with notes of beef stock and dried leaves. A clampy palate with rubbery tannins is the opposite of smooth, while this wine tastes of raw plum, berry fruits and grape skins. It feels pinchy on the finish.

title: Morgan 2016 Sauvignon Blanc (Monterey)
description: Light and crisp on the nose, this bottling shows passion fruit, lemon, chilled Anjou pear slices and a hint of grassy scents, proving broadly appealing. There is great zip to the sip and a bit of viscosity as well, with zesty flavors of green apple rinds and chopped lemongrass.

title: Mosnel 2012 Satèn  (Franciacorta)
description: Bread crust, toasted hazelnut and yellow stone-fruit aromas lead the nose. Mirroring the nose, the palate offers mature Golden Delicious apple, peach and bitter almond set against a foaming mousse.

title: Naggiar 2015 Zio Luciano Estate Grown Red (Sierra Foothills)
description: Abundant Bing cherry and black-plum flavors fill out this deeply colored, full-bodied and rather soft-textured wine. It tastes nicely concentrated and feels velvety on the palate due to fine-grained tannins.

title: Niepoort 2015 VV Vinhas Velhas Bical-Maria Gomes White (Bairrada)
description: Produced at the Quinta de Baixo in Bairrada, this is a delicious, juicy wine. Quince and kiwi flavors are laced with great acidity and with a texture so light that the wine dances on the palate. Drink this delicious wine now.

title: Rocca di Frassinello 2015 Ornello  (Maremma Toscana)
description: A blend of Sangiovese, Merlot, Cabernet Sauvignon and Syrah, this has aromas suggesting black-skinned berry, leather and underbrush. The firm palate delivers black currant, cedar and clove alongside fine-grained tannins.

title: Rosemont 2015 Kilvavock Red (Virginia)
description: This wine offers aromas of baked rhubarb, red plum, lavender, violets and rooibos. There is a lovely addition of cedar from the oak that is also present on the palate, along with red plum. Lively acidity and well-integrated tannins make for an attractive mouthfeel. The finish is long, evolving and full of spice.

title: Rudi Schultz 2015 Syrah (Stellenbosch)
description: An overt ripeness dominates the nose and mouth of this plush, decadent wine, as notes of black cherry and forest berry feel sauced and muddled together. The palate offers a more animal character, with cured meat and game notes that ride through to the spicy, coffee-laced finish. The velvety tannins and ample acidity are nicely balanced on the palate. Drink now.

title: Schäfer 2016 Made With Organic Grapes Dry-Style Riesling (Rheinhessen)
description: While light bodied and spry, there's a pleasantly silky mouthfeel to this easy going, elegant, dry Riesling. Lime-zest and green apple flavors are accented by hints of white florals and an invigorating lemon-juice finish. Drink now through 2020.

title: Seacampo 2015 Casa Américo Encruzado (Dão)
description: Just a touch of oak aging has given this wine a spicy character that enhances its rich, creamy texture and cool, clear character. With its apple and pear fruits and good acidity at the end, this wine still needs more time. Drink from late 2018.

title: Sokol Blosser 2014 Sparkling Rosé of Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)
description: This vintage sparkler is refined, crisp and clean, following the Méthode Champenoise. There's a hint of strawberry fruit and plenty of lemony acids. The bubbles are fine and the presentation classy. It should age nicely for up to a decade.

title: Twisted River 2016 Bin 568 Late Harvest Riesling (Mosel)
description: Exuberantly ripe yellow-peach and mango flavors are offset by a streak of crushed slate in this light-as-a-feather wine. It's not a deeply concentrated wine but fresh and pretty, with a lingering tangerine finish. Drink now.

title: Verve 2015 Croft Vineyards Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)
description: This solid, even chunky style brings brambly black-cherry fruit, dotted with scents and hints of fresh thyme. Cask fermented and barrel aged, it adds a light touch of chocolate to the finish.

title: Villa S. Anna 2013 Poldo  (Vino Nobile di Montepulciano)
description: Aromas of French oak, espresso, violet and dark spice slowly take shape. The austere palate shows raw cherry, dried sage and star anise set against a backbone of close-grained tannins.

title: Zen Garden 2016 Riesling (Pfalz)
description: Plump, peachy fruit tones are elegantly offset by fresh acidity and a lean mineral undertone. Light bodied and dry in style, it's a refreshing value wine with wide appeal. Drink now through 2019.
